Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) are under intensive investigation since the 1980's as these devices open the way for ecologically clean direct conversion of the chemical energy into electricity, avoiding the efficiency limitation by Carnot's cycle for thermochemical conversion.
Titulo: Combined theoretical and experimental analysis of processes determining cathode performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the practical development of SOFC faces a number of unresolved fundamental problems, in particular concerning the kinetics of the electrode reactions, especially oxygen reduction reaction.
Titulo: Combined theoretical and experimental analysis of processes determining cathode performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: We review recent experimental and theoretical achievements in the current understanding of the cathode performance by exploring and comparing mostly three materials: (La,Sr)MnO3 (LSM), (La,Sr)(Co,Fe)O-3 (LSCF) and (Ba,Sr)(Co,Fe)O-3 (BSCF).
Titulo: Combined theoretical and experimental analysis of processes determining cathode performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Special attention is paid to a critical evaluation of advantages and disadvantages of BSCF, which shows the best cathode kinetics known so far for oxides.
Titulo: Combined theoretical and experimental analysis of processes determining cathode performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: We demonstrate that it is the combined experimental and theoretical analysis of all major elementary steps of the oxygen reduction reaction which allows us to predict the rate determining steps for a given material under specific operational conditions and thus control and improve SOFC performance.
Titulo: Combined theoretical and experimental analysis of processes determining cathode performance in solid oxide fuel cells
